channel.title: Here's a moral question!
channel.description: Someone asked me this today, so I thought I'd ask you guys :).

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @redragonje65 redragonje65
item.description:
@redragonje65 wrote:

[quote=“pko, post:20, topic:119650”]Keep the 500 G’s, buy like 5 Grade A hookers for a month, and like 10 pounds of weed.

That would be fun.

The rest would go towards : Costumes, rubbers, ice packs, valium, sombaro’s, and new sheets.
Id give 100 G’s to my mom.
And I would keep the rest to buy a car, pay it off, and put a down payment on a house. Buy alot of new clothes, shoes, and stabalize a nice life.[/quote]

With $100 of my money, I would go to a gas station and fill bottles and bottles with gas. Then I’d go to your house and soak everything with it and your car too. Then I’ll go buy some matches and light your house on fire. With the rest of the money, I’ll pay to get out of jail…

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

OO this is kinda weird, yesterday on my school trip to thorpe park (amusment park) i was sitting waiting for my friends to get off a ride i didn’t want to go on and these 3 girls ran passed me. The place was very crowded. One of the running girls dropped a phone out of their pocket and kept on running without even noticing. No one else in that area noticed the phone fall to the floor. My immediate reaction was to run over pick it up and then run after the girls to give it back… and thats exactly what i did. What a bastard i am.

Read full topic

@LegendaryLoser wrote:

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @L.S.D L.S.D
item.description:
@L.S.D wrote:

id take it and get out of the country ASAP. id keep half of it and the other half would go to charity. besides that money in the armored car was probly going to some lazy rich people who dont pay taxes. so in reality im doing a more honest thing. =]

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“VB7 Rocks, post:12, topic:119650”][quote author=Ron link=topic=169067.msg1568601#msg1568601 date=1183564862]
I’d give it back. Once when I was little, I found $100 at the BAGC (boys and girls club) right near a trash can, and I gave it back.
[/quote]

Just a question, how did you know whose money it was? Was it in a wallet or was it just a $100 bill?[/quote]

I didn’t. The club has a main office, and I said someone dropped it on the floor in the rec room. A few days later, someone claimed it saying “blah blah I lost $100, I don’t know where it is, I lost it a few days ago” and the secretary and I did not tell anyone. So the secretary naturally gave the money and let me know about it. I think my dad bought me ice cream or something lol.

Not worth $100 bucks, but it’s something.

Read full topic

Keep the 500 G’s, buy like 5 Grade A hookers for a month, and like 10 pounds of weed.

The rest would go towards : Costumes, rubbers, ice packs, valium, sombaro’s, and new sheets.
Id give 100 G’s to my mom.
And I would keep the rest to buy a car, pay it off, and put a down payment on a house. Buy alot of new clothes, shoes, and stabalize a nice life.

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @therealjdb JDB`
item.description:
@therealjdb wrote:

PaulT:

Take it all, then give it away to homeless people. It probably belonged to a big company anyway and if it’s people’s money that is heading toward a bank it’s definitely insured. I’m happy and poor, so I would just give it to people who are unhappy and poor and hope they will figure out that money don’t buy you love.

No it doesn’t buy love but if I have a lot of money and some women convinced me to marry her and I fell in love with her, as long as I was happy I wouldn’t care if she ‘truly’ loved me back or just my money. Also if I had a lot of money maybe I’d rather have multiple wives, I’m between the bunch of them there is enough love for me or my money to make me happy.

Anyhow, I’d keep the money spend it in small amount or transfer it to separate bank accounts. Yah, I’m a horrible person but I could live with it .

Read full topic

Take it all, then give it away to homeless people. It probably belonged to a big company anyway and if it’s people’s money that is heading toward a bank it’s definitely insured. I’m happy and poor, so I would just give it to people who are unhappy and poor and hope they will figure out that money don’t buy you love.

Or they could just get a hooker pregnant and be forced to marry her, then have a couple of loving children.

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

Ron:

I’d give it back. Once when I was little, I found $100 at the BAGC (boys and girls club) right near a trash can, and I gave it back.

Just a question, how did you know whose money it was? Was it in a wallet or was it just a $100 bill?

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I’d give it back. Once when I was little, I found $100 at the BAGC (boys and girls club) right near a trash can, and I gave it back. That was when I was little and much more impressionable. My family is quite eitherical and the last thing we would do is do something that “makes us look cool.”

We’re weird people because we’re honest. Much of humanity could learn from it.

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @MastrChief MastrChief
item.description:
@MastrChief wrote:

I’d still burn it.

Really think about the situation though, $3,000,000 or Euros, whichever you like more, feel out of the back of someone’s car, and they didn’t know. When actually put in the situation, you would think both ways. I know it makes you look cool to say you’d give it back, but what would you really do?

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @Eh_Pretty_Easy Eh Pretty Easy
item.description:
@Eh_Pretty_Easy wrote:

If the money would be for good cause I’d give it back, but if it was used for something like a rocket then I’d never give it back. And I’d donate most of it anyways to the charity, keep 100k to myself and leave.

Read full topic

item.title: Here's a moral question!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Eh Pretty Easy:

Keep it and run, who would give it back?

Reason why they should start having morale classes in school like they do in other countries. Sorry for using you as an example Eh Pretty Easy.

If you ever heard the saying “Put yourself in the other person’s shoes…” then you can understand why you should give it back.

The person’s hard earned money, or inheritance or money to save his daughter from being killed by kidnappers, just fell off on the road and people would be selfish enough to keep the money. How cold hearted can you be?

If you knew the person that had the cash which fell off on to the road and he/she was a horrible person and you knew that they were not going to use it for any good, then at least there could be some justification. Other than that, I still say it’s wrong.

Edit: Used the wrong “there.”

Read full topic
